items.before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"b6qr5","text":"This protocol describes the amplification of the VP1 region and library preparation for sequencing poliovirus isolates. We anticipate users will have performed an RNA extraction prior to starting this protocol. We recommend the MagMAX Viral RNA Isolation Kit for this process.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79ens","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ng1n","text":"Barcoded VP1 Primers: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97shh","text":"\nTo allow a simplified protocol, we use a 96-well primer plate with 5µM barcoded Y7 primer and 5µM barcoded Q8 primer in each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4jvv","text":"Each well contains Q8 and Y7 primers with the same unique barcode e.g A1 = Y7 with barcode 1 and Q8 with barcode 1, A2 = Y7 with barcode 2 and Q8 with barcode 2, etc. The full set of 96 barcoded primer sequences are shown in Dataset_S1 of Shaw et al, 2020.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9llbj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39rmc","text":"These primers can be ordered premixed or as two separate plates then mixed in the lab. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
items.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2e1ir","text":"This protocol is adapted from \"Direct Detection of poliovirus and Nanopore Sequencing (DDNS) - Stool\" to make it suitable for use with cell culture isolates in either a liquid form or that have been transported to the lab via FTA card.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6smuo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4limv","text":"The protocol aims to amplify the VP1 region of poliovirus through a single PCR using the Q8/Y7 primer set. We use barcoded primers as this greatly simplifies the subsequent library preparation process. Primer sequences for the barcoded Q8/Y7 primers are found in Dataset S1 of Shaw et al (2020). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a34uv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tjar","text":"This protocol is for use with Oxford Nanopore v14 chemistry sequencing reagents and can be used with the MinION Mk1B or GridION sequencer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ri45","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ed2pj","text":"Within the protocol, quality control steps are included which when followed ensures the validity of your results and provides easier troubleshooting when needed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjqvk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

items.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"40fqp","text":"This protocol presents a comprehensive, beginner-friendly standard operating procedure (SOP) for core cell culture techniques, including thawing, subculturing, cryopreserving cell lines, and performing the MTT cytotoxicity assay. The protocol provides step-by-step instructions to guide users through handling, maintaining, and evaluating mammalian cell cultures under sterile conditions. Following the workflow, users can consistently recover, expand, and preserve healthy cell lines while minimizing contamination. The MTT assay protocol yields quantitative measures of cell viability and enables generation of reproducible dose–response curves and IC₅₀ values. Together, these procedures ensure reliable cell culture performance and robust experimental outcomes suitable for research and training environments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"elkkb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tutl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

items.warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"csjh4","text":"Critical warnings when handling the liquid nitrogen (LN₂):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9h4br","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bk39s","text":"Avoid any skin contact with LN₂ or cold vapors to prevent instant frostbite. This could be achieved by wearing proper cryogenic PPE","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1tslr","text":"Nitrogen displaces oxygen, therefore, always handle in well-ventilated areas","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15ss7","text":"Prevent splashes and spills of LN₂ by slow handling, avoid overfilling, and remove gloves/shoes immediately if LN₂ enters them.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

authors.affiliation: Quantum Medical Diagnostics, Overland Park, Kansas, USA
authors.name: Dr. Luis F. Acevedo

items.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"sajyz","text":"We introduce a novel microscopy platform that seamlessly integrates quantum sensing with advanced 3D live-cell imaging. This system enables long-term, non-invasive monitoring of cells within 3D cultures by combining ultra-sensitive field detection with multiplane light microscopy, optical trapping, and quantum-enhanced particle tracking in a single instrument. The configuration allows delicate samples to remain undisturbed on the microscope stage for multiple days, while quantum sensors provide nanoscale insights into the local microenvironment. Using engineered hydrogel, spheroid breast cancer models, and bone marrow-derived stem cell cultures, we observe dynamic remodeling of the extracellular matrix (ECM) alongside quantum-level signatures of cellular interactions. This technology establishes a new paradigm in live-cell imaging, bridging optical microscopy and quantum biosensing to advance biomedical diagnostics, stem cell monitoring, and the characterization of biophysical cell signatures.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
items.guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ddr7","text":"Prepare a Nature-style manuscript with a concise title, authors, abstract, introduction, results (including 3D imaging of HSCs and cancer cells with quantum probes, Cy5 labeling, and optical parameters of 100 μJ/s at 100 MHz), discussion, conclusion/outlook, detailed materials and methods, statistical analysis, data/code availability, acknowledgments, author contributions, competing interests, disclaimer, references, and supplementary material including extended datasets and videos.\n\n","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ulq7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
items.materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"ckjnh","text":"Cell Models.

Human hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) were isolated from bone marrow–derived samples (Lonza, USA) and expanded in serum-free StemSpan‱ SFEM II medium supplemented with stem cell factor (SCF, 100 ng/mL), thrombopoietin (TPO, 50 ng/mL), and FLT3-Ligand (100 ng/mL). Breast cancer spheroids (MDA-MB-231) were generated using ultra-low attachment 96-well plates (Corning, USA) and maintained in DMEM with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS) and 1% penicillin-streptomycin at 37 °C and 5% CO₂. For co-culture assays, HSCs were introduced into spheroid cultures at a 1:5 ratio to enable analysis of stem–cancer microenvironmental interactions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":147,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"13uap","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afpju","text":"Hydrogel and 3D Matrix Preparation.

Engineered hydrogels were synthesized using methacrylated gelatin (GelMA, 10% w/v) with 0.25% (w/v) Irgacure 2959 as photoinitiator. Polymerization was performed under 405 nm illumination for 30 s, yielding a matrix with an elastic modulus between 0.5–1 kPa, mimicking the native extracellular matrix (ECM). Quantum probes and cells were co-embedded during polymerization to maintain spatial homogeneity and preserve cellular integrity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apuu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jjor","text":"Quantum Probes and Fluorophores.

Fluorescent quantum probes were based on nitrogen-vacancy (NV) nanodiamonds (mean diameter ~50 nm; Adamas Nanotechnologies, USA) with high photostability and spin coherence times >1 µs. The probes were suspended in PBS (pH 7.4) and dispersed at 10 µg/mL into the GelMA matrix prior to cell seeding. Cellular structures were labeled with Cy5 dye (Thermo Fisher Scientific) to visualize membranes and improve contrast during multi-day imaging. Quantum probes were excited using a 532 nm laser and fluorescence was detected in the 650–800 nm range using dichroic beam splitting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hpba","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"df5dp","text":"Microscopy and Optical Configuration.

The quantum-integrated microscopy platform combined light-sheet illumination, optical trapping, multiplane imaging, and quantum-enhanced particle tracking within a closed, temperature-controlled (37 °C, 5% CO₂) chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnpa1","text":"Illumination power: 100 μJ s⁻¹ per sample.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5621e","text":"Sampling frequency: 100 MHz.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"prg7","text":"Objective lenses: 40× water immersion (NA = 1.15, Leica) and 60× oil immersion (NA = 1.40, Olympus).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asfdb","text":"Lasers: 405 nm (gel activation), 488 nm (cell autofluorescence), 532 nm (NV excitation), 647 nm (Cy5 excitation).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qi53","text":"Detection system: EMCCD (Andor iXon Ultra 897) coupled with a motorized z-stage for multiplane scanning (Δz = 500 nm).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e15jq","text":"Optical filters: 550–800 nm emission range for NV fluorescence; 670–720 nm for Cy5 emission.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39ail","text":"Quantum sensing module: Microwave excitation loop antenna (2.87 GHz) positioned adjacent to the sample chamber to drive NV spin transitions.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"do1nu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1vfl","text":"Calibration and Sensitivity Standards.

System calibration was performed using fluorescent microspheres (Thermo Fisher, 100 nm, emission = 680 nm) embedded in an agarose gel for spatial registration and photon-count normalization. Quantum probe sensitivity was benchmarked with a calibrated magnetic field (10 µT–1 mT range) and verified through ODMR (optically detected magnetic resonance) spectra. Optical power stability was maintained within ±2% across the entire imaging duration. Temperature fluctuations during multi-day imaging did not exceed ±0.1 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6kbbe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qs71","text":"Data Processing and Analysis.

Fluorescence and quantum-sensing data were analyzed using MATLAB (MathWorks), FIJI (ImageJ), and Python-based custom scripts. Time-resolved signal mapping was used to extract quantum coherence decay (T₂) and field fluctuations. ECM remodeling and nanoscale mechanical shifts were evaluated through temporal autocorrelation and spatial cross-section analysis. Data were normalized to fluorescence intensity and optical power to account for day-to-day variations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3949E4CCB5B711F097760A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}
items.title: Quantum-Integrated Microscopy Platform for Live 3D Cell Imaging and Multicellular Sensing Protocol v1

items.warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"7bg1f","text":"Laser and Optical Safety: Experiments involve high-intensity laser illumination (up to 100 μJ/s per sample); proper eye protection and beam containment are required.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mpne","text":"Microwave Exposure: Quantum sensing uses 2.87 GHz microwaves; avoid direct exposure to personnel and follow institutional safety protocols.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5c8jc","text":"Biological Materials: Human hematopoietic stem cells and cancer cell lines must be handled under appropriate biosafety level conditions (BSL-2).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhna3","text":"Phototoxicity: Long-term live-cell imaging may induce phototoxic effects; maintain low exposure and verify cell viability.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fea1k","text":"Chemical Hazards: Use caution with GelMA, photoinitiators, and fluorescent dyes; handle according to MSDS guidelines.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40hoq","text":"Electrical Equipment: Ensure proper grounding and calibration of all optical and electronic instruments to prevent hazards.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

items.before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"983nu","text":"All solutions and equipment that come in contact with the cells must be sterile. Always use proper sterile technique and work in a laminar flow hood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
items.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5m21f","text":"This protocol outlines a systematic approach for the preservation of animal cells (especially Vero E6), aimed at maintaining cellular integrity, viability, and functionality during storage and subsequent thawing. The primary goal is to optimize long-term storage methods to support cell-based research and clinical applications","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
items.guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"4irji","text":"Store the frozen cells below –70°C; frozen cells begin to deteriorate above –50°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
items.materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"96r13","text":"Culture vessels containing cultured cells in log-phase of growth","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"348bf","text":"Complete growth medium, pre-warmed to 37°C","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5scg2","text":"Balanced salt solution such as Phosphate Buffered Saline (PBS), containing no calcium, magnesium, or phenol red","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c06tk","text":"Dissociation reagent such as trypsin","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"et0es","text":"Cryoprotective agent such as DMSO ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afqmh","text":"Disposable, sterile 15-mL or 50-mL conical tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5me5i","text":"Equipment to determine viable and total cell counts such as hemacytometer or Coulter Counter ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"718o2","text":"Sterile cryogenic storage vials (cryovials)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4f5je","text":"Controlled rate freezing apparatus or isopropanol chamber\t","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8opkf","text":"Liquid nitrogen storage container","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bb8f8","text":"Freezing medium- 20% FBS + 10% DMSO in cell culture media","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpr2p","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
items.title: Cryopreservation of Cells
items.warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"eairm","text":"DMSO at concentrations higher than 10% (v/v) is reported to induce membrane pore formation and apoptosis, thus Time is thus a critical factor when you freeze cells to minimize their exposure to DMSO.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

items.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8i54","text":"This protocol describes the synthesis of first-strand complementary DNA (cDNA) from total RNA extracted from epithelial cell cultures of HNSCC cell lines using the Bio-Rad iScript cDNA Synthesis Kit. The method is optimized for downstream quantitative real-time PCR (RT-qPCR) applications and gene expression analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
items.guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"7n2t5","text":"Notes and Best Practices","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rb2n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qqod","text":"RNA Handling: Always work in an RNase-free environment. Use dedicated pipettes and filter tips for RNA work.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edf29","text":"Reaction Scaling: The protocol can be scaled to 10 µL reactions (half volumes) if RNA is limited, though 20 µL reactions are recommended for optimal performance.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2au5","text":"Primer Design Consideration: The iScript kit contains a blend of oligo(dT) and random hexamer primers, providing unbiased 3' and 5' coverage. Design qPCR primers accordingly.​","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mvrs","text":"Dynamic Range: The iScript kit supports RNA inputs from 1 pg to 1 µg, making it suitable for both high and low-abundance transcripts.​","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"act53","text":"No-Template Control (NTC): In addition to no-RT controls, include a no-template control (water only) in downstream qPCR reactions to monitor for contamination.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a86u6","text":"Documentation: Record all calculations, lot numbers of reagents, and thermal cycler used for full traceability and reproducibility.​","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"esp1l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

capability","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhgdq","text":"Microcentrifuge","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cbv","text":"Vortex mL PCR tubes (thin-walled, nuclease-free)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1nn99","text":"Nuclease-free pipette tips (filter tips mL)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fuqb2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efjet","text":"Reagents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gc7d","text":"Bio-Rad iScript cDNA Synthesis Kit (Cat# 1708890/1708891) containing:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2po8h","text":"  5× iScript Reaction Mix (4 µL per 20 µL reaction)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dpfq","text":" iScript Reverse Transcriptase (1 µL per 20 µL
